meanings.definition: A person who carries or hauls something.
meanings.sent1: The toters helped move the heavy boxes.
meanings.sent2: The delivery person is a skilled toter.
meanings.sent3: The toters raced to see who could carry the most.
meanings.sent4: She was a toter of dreams, carrying hope wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The toters in the circus amazed the audience with their strength.

meanings.definition: A device or tool used for carrying or transporting items.
meanings.sent1: The workers used toters to move the furniture.
meanings.sent2: The shopping cart is a common toter in supermarkets.
meanings.sent3: The toters in the warehouse were always in high demand.
meanings.sent4: His backpack was like a loyal toter, always ready to carry his belongings.
meanings.sent5: The toter with wheels made it easy to transport the heavy load.

meanings.sent1: She toters the groceries from the car to the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The movers will toter the boxes into the new house.
meanings.sent3: He toters his backpack everywhere, even to the bathroom.
meanings.sent4: The river toters debris downstream after a storm.
meanings.sent5: The ants toters food back to their nest with great efficiency.
